p: The total dissimilarities between non-invaded and invaded quadrats were 44.43, 87.06, 40.13, and 29.02 in Yangyuan, Huailai, Zhangjiakou, and Fushun, respectively. The most commonly occurring species collectively explained 79.98%, 54.24%, 60.65%, and 82.78% of the total dissimilarities found in Yangyuan, Huailai, Zhangjiakou, and Fushun, respectively. According to non-metric multidimensional scaling ordination and similarity analysis, the differences in species compositions between invaded and non-invaded quadrats were also significant, with global statistics R values found 0.62 ( P < 0.01), 0.943 ( P < 0.01), 0.779 ( P < 0.01), and 0.553 ( P < 0.01) in Yangyuan, Huailai, Zhangjiakou, and Fushun, respectively (S2 Fig in S1 File).
